page.title: 02CROPS AT MID-DOD FARM
page.content:
The{farming}land and of Mid-Dod farm is approximately 482 acres. The three main{crops}are spring barley and winter wheat and barley. Mid-Dod is mainly an arable farm. Oil seed rape and peas are relatively new crops and seem to be developing fairly well. The busiest time of year on the farm is between July and September.
{CROP MARKETING}- There is 70 acres of barley on the farm, and all of this is sold to the Moray Firth Malting Company in Arbroath. The farmer keeps the stalks to use as animal bedding in winter. The 30 acres of oil seed rape is sent down south to be crushed into {food}as edible fats and margarine. The stalks are not good for bedding so the farmer uses them as fuel.
